author: Gabriele Steinhauser
title: South Africa’s Zuma Digs In Heels After Ruling Party Orders Him to Resign
text:
JOHANNESBURG—An escalating standoff between South Africa’s two most powerful politicians plunged the presidential-succession saga into disarray and threatened to fracture the continent’s most famous liberation movement.

On Tuesday, the African National Congress—the party that ended white-minority rule—gave President Jacob Zuma 24 hours to hand power to Cyril Ramaphosa, the deputy president and party leader. Mr. Zuma refused to resign, demanding an extra three to six months in office and raising the prospect of a protracted...
